entry.title: [Reland] Migrate security_interstitials to JS modules.
entry.content:
Reland notes: Added missing dependency in

//android_webview:generate_components_resources target.



Security interstitials UIs are not proper WebUI pages and therefore they

can't load any dependencies at runtime, as there is no backing

WebUIDataSource to serve them.



For this reason, these UIs resort to bundling all the code to a single

JS and HTML file pair at buildtime. Currently this is achieved by using

Grit which is problematic because:

- It relies on Grit's obsolete flattenhtml=true mechanism

- It doesn't work with JS modules (Grit simply concatenates files)



Addressed here by leveraging the bundle_js() GN rule which is the

canonical way in the codebase for generating JS bundles from

modularized JS code.



This removes one of the last few non-JS module code in the codebase, and

paves the way for further migrating such files to TypeScript.



Bug: 1347008

Change-Id: I31a7739226520da9c53db7dd63c5f40e17f9d0c9

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4955633

Reviewed-by: Bo Liu

Commit-Queue: Demetrios Papadopoulos

Reviewed-by: Rebekah Potter

Reviewed-by: Carlos IL

entry.title: Make PlusAddresses Desktop modal use the Reserve+Confirm flow.
entry.content:
The modal only appears after PlusAddressService completes a network

request to Reserve a plus address.



If the call is successful, the PlusAddress modal is shown with the

reserved plus address.



Pressing the "Ok" button of the modal will now make a network request to Confirm the reserved plus address for use. If this call succeeds,

the confirmed plus address is autofilled.



Future CLs will:

- Bring this behavior to the Android modal

- Add a check to the OnPlusAddressReserved response to prevent

re-confirming an a plus address

- Propagate any errors up to the calling controller

- Handle call to Reserve asynchronously (to immediately show the modal

change its text)



Bug: 1467623 b/303051025 b/299671283

Change-Id: Iff8bd71ecb1ad40c7382fc89075c1b7212e8299c

entry.title: mgs: enable AppKM in MGS if policy is enabled
entry.content:
This is the first CL to enable AppKM in MGS. AppKM are reported for MGS

only if `UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled` policy is enabled.



`UrlKeyedAnonymizedDataCollectionEnabled` policy is not available in

the admin console, so current changes are hidden behind this policy.



With this change AppKM is reported only for long sessions (>2 hours).

Metrics for shorter sessions are erased on user logout, since MGS

clean up all user preferences. That will be fixed in the following

CLs.



Also AppKM will be restricted to admins-configured apps only in the

following CLs.



Bug: b/303610964

Change-Id: If714021abe5502b2fd0f0ddb0e09181bc2905ce5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4928548

entry.title: [shared storage] Use separate mojom channels for worklet creation (addModule) and for other operations (selectURL/run)
entry.content:
What: Currently, The mojom::SharedStorageDocumentService channel

is used to create the worklet (i.e. handle addModule), and is also

used to route future worklet operations to SharedStorageWorkletHost.

This CL decouples the two things. Note that the new channel is

still associated with mojom::SharedStorageDocumentService (which is

associated with the default navigation mojom channel), so that

worklet operations before navigating away can be handled reliably.



We also combine the handling of "creating worklet" and "addModule"

because they always occur together. By doing this, we can remove some

assertions on addModule status.



Also, move more permission checks to the renderer, and

ReportbadMessage at mojom boundary: 1) addModule can only be called

once, 2) addModule must be called before selectURL()/run(),

3) selectURL()/run() cannot be called if a previous call didn't

have {keepAlive: true}



Why: This prepares for a potential future change to allow multiple

worklets per Document. Nevertheless, a decoupled architecture is

generally better.



Bug: 1218540

Change-Id: Idc2b5df326ba75806f293d881fb9fb00fe80601e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4947893

Reviewed-by: Cammie Smith Barnes

Commit-Queue: Yao Xiao

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

Reviewed-by: Avi Drissman

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212380}

entry.title: Revert "Use fastset for VRR modesetting"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 216d3120eaa516acf457a213b3e3d7df334cb33d.



Reason for revert: Use-after-free detected by MSan: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/39087/overview



Original change's description:

> Use fastset for VRR modesetting

>

> This change enforces the use of seamless modesetting for changes

> affecting the VRR_ENABLED crtc property, which has previously always

> allowed full modesets. Now that support for VRR fastsetting has been

> backported, it is not necessary to allow full modesets when changing

> the VRR_ENABLED state.

>

> This change also removes a workaround which required full modesetting

> to change the refresh rate throttling state whenever VRR_ENABLED was

> active. Now that the fix has been backported, seamless modesets can be

> used in this scenario.

>

> Bug: b:300915382

entry.title: Check UserColor ThemeID for dynamic color histogram
entry.content:
Setting a UserColor (GM3 color) sets the ThemeID to kUserColorThemeID

so GM3 colors, other than grayscale, are not being caught by the

histogram. Therefore, moved RecordDynamicColorOnLoadHistogram() under

a check for kUserColorThemeID instead of kDefaultThemeID.



Grayscale is a subset of baseline so it is kept under the

kDefaultThemeID check.



Because RecordDynamicColorOnLoadHistogram() is a static method, I'm

unsure how to write a unit test for this without basically just

writing the unit test that method already has in |ChromeColorService|

again in theme_service_unittest.

entry.title: WebUI Mojo Bindings: Make TypeScript the default
entry.content:
Change mojo bindings logic to generate WebUI bindings in TypeScript by

default, instead of JavaScript. Since JS is not allowed for new code

on Desktop, also add an assertion that any bindings targets that

specify JavaScript for WebUI bindings are either on ChromeOS Ash or

correspond to a couple remaining shared targets whose migrations are

blocked by various ChromeOS Closure Compiler usages.



Note: Also removing a few "use_typescript_sources = true" which are

used without webui_module_path, since these have no effect (only

WebUI bindings can be generated in TypeScript, and webui_module_path

controls whether to generate these).

entry.title: Rename 3pcd fieldtrial study names
entry.content:
The fieldtrial testing must use the actual study names to be recognized

by finch.



This fails a PRESUBMIT rule:

"The following feature(s) were specified in multiple studies:

CookieDeprecationFacilitatedTesting (in studies

CookieDeprecationFacilitatedTestingLabelOnly,

CookieDeprecationFacilitatedTestingCookieDeprecation)



We therefore by-pass the check which is OK according to the doc:

"In those cases, the PRESUBMIT check can be bypassed. Since this will

only check for studies that were changed in this particular commit,

bypassing the PRESUBMIT check will not block future commits."



No-Presubmit: true

entry.title: Add invoketarget/invokeaction attributes
entry.content:
This adds support for the experimental `invoketarget` and `invokeaction`

attributes, as specified in the open-ui "Invokers" explainer.



(https://open-ui.org/components/invokers.explainer/)



The `invoketarget` attribute maps to the IDL `invokeTargetElement`,

similar to `popoverTargetElement`, and the `invokeaction` is a freeform

string.



The Button behaviour checks for `invokeTargetElement` in its activation

behaviour, and dispatches an `InvokeEvent` if there is one.



This also adds some basic scaffolding for `HandleInvokeInternal` which

will allow elements to provide their own invocation action algorithms.



Bug: 1490919



I2P: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/tDanwUCp2cg/m/IPc9hvHcFAAJ





Co-authored-by: Keith Cirkel

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=jkarlin@chromium.org



Bug: 1491463

Change-Id: I9a8ca8520d1b8e0d60404eb7ad16c655aa1f2cb5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935872

entry.title: [Extensions] Skip killing renderer in certain situations.
entry.content:
Before this change we would kill the renderer with a bad message if the

result of finishing the external request was anything other than

content::ServiceWorkerExternalRequestResult::kOk. There's evidence that

content::ServiceWorkerExternalRequestResult::kWorkerNotFound and

content::ServiceWorkerExternalRequestResult::kWorkerNotRunning are

occurring frequently. It seems likely that there is a race with

`worker_stopped` which causes it to not be accurate and so we don't

return early.



After this change we will not kill the renderer for these two statuses.

We don't expect any behavioral change except to avoid crashing the

(service worker-based) extension renderer.



This is a quick fix to prevent a release delay.



Change-Id: Ic9105058b94be7074a121f850f3b1c44a254fd74

Bug: 1485425

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4953976

entry.title: ui: de-constify GetWebUIMessageHandlers
entry.content:
This method is specified to return a vector of owning pointers to WebUI

message handlers, and is marked const. That means that a correct

implementation is required to freshly allocate new message handlers each

time the method is called; the receiver can't extract return stored

pointers that it owns, because it would have to invalidate its own

copies of them in the process, which would mutate the receiver.



That prevents a correct base class implementation with setters for the

default value; fix that by de-constifying the getter method, and adding

an AddWebUIMessageHandler() method for client classes to register

message handlers to be returned by the base class's

GetWebUIMessageHandlers() implementation. Followup changes will

eliminate remaining overrides of GetWebUIMessageHandlers() and replace

all uses with calls to AddWebUIMessageHandler().



This change also removes all empty overrides of

GetWebUIMessageHandlers(), to make the later refactoring easier.



Bug: 1485127

Change-Id: I2894c4a965841603afbe1190b4e4b5bf226954dc

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4949095

entry.title: [FLEDGE] Add WPT test for ties.
entry.content:
In the case two bids have the same score, either interest group can win

an auction. This adds a single test to make sure that two interest bids

with the same score can each win an auction. This doesn't check that

they each win half the time (since tesing random number generators is

involved an slow).



To make the test run in reasonable time, it uses a component auction.

The inner auction has two IGs with the same score, and the outer

auction rejects ads from an interest group that has already won an

auction (updating the script to do this after one group has won).

This avoids needing to load the winning ad in a fenced frame each

time there's a winner, which is potentially slow, and allows auctions

to be run in parallel.



Bug: 1425952

Change-Id: I98958d6579e7a78e6ef802be5baf822c1ad5e971

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4951800

entry.title: [text-spacing-trim] Support quotation marks
entry.content:
Quotation marks are one of the code point that are most

complicated, because of the Unicode unification unified Latin

curly quotes and CJK fullwidth quotes.



This patch detects if the font has:

* Whether fullwidth glyphs or not.

* Whether they're open/close glyphs or not.

and apply open/close types if both are true. Otherwise they

are narrow open/close.



They're commonly used in Chinese, and that Chinese fonts often

assign fullwidth glyphs, while most Japanese fonts prioritize

the Latin usage and thus assign Latin proportional glyphs.



In vertical flow, some Chinese fonts assign bracket glyphs,

so that it preserves semantics rather than glyph shapes.

Japanese glyphs are most diverged, there are too many

variations. Adobe's Japanese convention uses the OpenType

`fwid` feature to switch between Japanese and Latin glyphs,

and that the behavior of the vertical upright glyph without

the `fwid` is undefined. Other vendors take other approaches.



Bug: 1463891

Change-Id: Ie9dee55ff8f9fbd35e72288db7c3c37fc668b531

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4938492

Reviewed-by: Lingqi Chi

Commit-Queue: Koji Ishii

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1212282}

entry.title: ash: Fix crash when displays are removed during rotation
entry.content:
We found that in the middle of display rotation, displays can be

removed. Previously, the `ScreenRotationAnimator` used to be an

owned window property of the root window that remains alive as long

as the root window lives, even though we may have destroyed all its

containers as part of shutting down its `RootWindowController`.



This CL changes the ownership of the `ScreenRotationAnimator` to be

owned by `RootWindowController`, and it gets destroyed when

`Shutdown()` is called. It also prevents it from being recreated once

the `Shutdown()` has been called.



Fixed: b/293667233

entry.title: android: startup: remove assert when same-document nav commits first

entry.title: Embed metadata to Java targets
entry.content:
* The Cronet team is maintaining a python script which is responsible for translating GN targets into Soong (Android/AOSP).

It's used to translate both native(C++) targets and Java targets. However, we are finding it extremely difficult to translate Java

targets as they are not as direct as the C++ because of multiple layers of targets chaining each such(ex: `__dex` target

using the result from `__compile_java`).

* Embed the pure `sources`, `deps` and `type` into the root `group` which will make it much easier to parse as we don't have

to parse targets such as `__compile_java`, `__dex_java` because we can get the information we need from the `group`.



This is how a target looks like after the change:



```

"//components/cronet/android:cronet_impl_native_base_java": {

"deps": ["//components/cronet/android:cronet_impl_native_base_java__assetres", "//components/cronet/android:cronet_impl_native_base_java__dex", "//components/cronet/android:cronet_impl_native_base_java__process_device", "//components/cronet/android:cronet_impl_native_base_java__validate", "A lot Of Other Deps"],

"metadata": {

"all_deps": ["//base:jni_java", "//build/android:build_java", "A lot of Other deps without any auto generated ones." ],

"cur_type": [ "java_library" ],

"source_files": [ "//components/cronet/android/java/src/org/chromium/net/httpflags/BaseFeature.java", "A lot of other sources]

},

"public": "*",

"testonly": false,

"toolchain": "//build/toolchain/android:android_clang_x64",

"type": "group",

"visibility": [ "*" ]

},

```



Bug: 1449896

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4942673

entry.title: [SHv2] Improve the Safety Hub animations based on UX feedback
entry.content:
- Animation timing now follows a curve.

- Opacity is decreased to 0 at the keyframe 100%, not already at 20%.

the header had at most 3 lines both before and after the animation).

- In the unused sites and notifications modules, the bulk action

button has an optimization to immediately update the card header.

- The separator line now has custom keyframes which more precisely fit

its initial width.

entry.title: [//ash] Add path for FastInkHost to use a single SharedImage
entry.content:
Currently, FastInkHost creates a GpuMemoryBuffer and passes that to each

UiResource, which create individual SharedImages backed by that

GpuMemoryBuffer. This flow is problematic for converting the

GpuMemoryBuffer to MappableSharedImage.



This CL adds a path wherein FastInkHost instead creates a single

SharedImage that all of its UiResources use and owns that SharedImage.

One subtlety here is that the current lifetime of the SharedImages are

tied to that of of the UiResources, which are tied to UiResourceManager,

which can outlive FastInkHost itself. However, that architecture is due

to an outdated need for the client to keep SharedImages alive as long

as the compositor is using them - the display compositor will now keep

SharedImages alive for as long as it needs them. Hence, it is sufficient

for FastInkHost to tie the SharedImage to its own lifetime.



The new codepath is disabled by default.



I will update unittest paths to test the new flow once it starts to

stick.



Bug: 1431257

entry.title: Replace another batch of Theora tests with vp8/vp9.
entry.content:
In preparation for disabling Theora, this updates tests to

use vp8 in ogg or vp9 in webm where applicable. This turns

out to fix some tests which were trying to use ogg+flac

which we've never supported.



Unfortunately this results in a large number of rebaselines

added by `rebaseline-cl`, but they all look correct. There's

some color shifting as vp8/vp9 now carry color space tags

where theora did not (assumed bt.601).



Some cases were using 4:4:4 sampling with theora in ogv, but

that's not supported by vp8, so those had to be switched to

using webm + vp9.

entry.title: [ios][start_surface] Use base::TimeDelta to express duration
entry.content:
Instead of using primitive types and comments (or naming convention) to

represent duration with their unit, use base::TimeDelta. Use the helper

function base::Hours(), base::Days(), ... to create constants.



This simplify the use of the value returned by the function and make it

clearer which quantities are compared or to which scale the value is

converted to (via .InSeconds(), .InHours(), ... methods).



While doing this, fix some style issue with parameters and variables and

remove unnecessary conversion between NSString and std::u16string.

entry.title: ATP: Add speech recognition skeleton
entry.content:
This change wires up a speech recognition skeleton in ATP, plus fully

implemented versions of start(), stop(), and onStop event. See

go/chromeos-atp-api-speech-recognition-private for full details.



In short, here are the high-level components to this change:

1. Basic skeleton for speech recognition in ATP e.g. binding functions,

mojo interface definition

2. Implementation of ATP speech recognition in SpeechRecognitionImpl,

with browser tests

3. The JavaScript shim of speech recognition, with unit tests



The remainder of speech recognition functionality will be implemented

in follow-up CLs.

entry.title: Update the modification date in the PDM instead of AutofillTable.
entry.content:
Currently, AutofillTable is responsible for updating the modification

date of profiles to the current time. Arguably, this should not be

AutofillTable's responsibility, as it generally acts as a data store

without additional logic. Similar operations, such as updating the

use count are done in the PDM. And in fact, updating in AutofillTable

has caused a bug in Sync code that's fixed by this CL.



This CL moves the updating of the modification date to the PDM.



-- CL motivation/bigger picture --

The PDM reloads all data after pending profile modifications have

finished. The ultimate goal (http://crrev.com/c/4864947) is removing

this reload.



Currently, the PDM only learns about the updated modification date

through the reload, since the profile the PDM receives through

OnAutofillProfileChanged() is the profile originally passed in [1].

By moving the updating of the modification date into the PDM, one less

reason for the reload exists.



-- The Sync bug that this happens to fix --

Sync code operates on AutofillTable directly and is hence not affected

by the logic in the PDM. This CL thus changes the Sync behavior. There

are two cases:

- kAccount profiles sync the modification date [2]. When an update

arrives through Sync, the proto is converted to an AutofillProfile and

AutofillTable is updated.

The AutofillTable logic currently ignores the profile's modification

date and just overwrites the table's state with the current time.

Consequently, the modification date is effectively not synced.

As of this CL, since AutofillTable just uses the profile's

modification date, syncing actually works.

- kLocalOrSyncable profiles don't sync their modification date - it's

not part of the proto. Before and after this change, whenever profiles

arrive through sync, their modification date is set to the current

time. Right now this happens through the logic in AutofillTable. As of

this CL this happens due to the initialization of the modification

date in AutofillProfile [2].



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/webdata/autofill_webdata_backend_impl.cc;l=344-347;drc=31fb07c05718d671d96c227855bfe97af9e3fb20

[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/sync/protocol/contact_info_specifics.proto;l=87;drc=a7c8c724ba2322aa0100385907e6727395a05d0d

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:components/autofill/core/browser/data_model/autofill_data_model.cc;l=17;drc=4c14887e9e0c7975a007ab29790f725c3d54a66f



Bug: 1420547

Change-Id: Iffe0eb18ba3daf1f225ec80be92ea514e137aefb

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=kinuko@chromium.org

entry.title: Color-mix for canvas 2d
entry.content:
It seems pretty straightforward that we should support this:



https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/canvas.html#dom-context-2d-fillstyle



"""

The fillStyle setter steps are:



If the given value is a string, then:



Let parsedValue be the result of parsing the given value with this's canvas attribute's value.

"""



Then at https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/infrastructure.html#parsed-as-a-css-color-value



"""

To parse a CSS value, given a string input with an optional

element element, run these steps:



Let color be the result of parsing input as a CSS . [CSSCOLOR]

"""

entry.title: Reland "[ChromeOS Flex] Add device policy for sending hw data"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 18cd84f099e46ce52e272cb15b2efbf3e1bbd1a4



The original commit left a "Proto" at the end of the policy name in

device_policy_proto_map.yaml



Original change's description:

> [ChromeOS Flex] Add device policy for sending hw data

>

> This adds a new device policy for managed ChromeOS Flex devices to

> control whether detailed hardware component data can collected for

> product improvement purposes. We'd like the administrator to be very

> clear on what the data will be used for, and not piggy-back on other

> policies that allow data collection intended for customer use.

>

> This is Flex-only, sending hardware data, for product improvement.

> Device policies should start with "Device", according to a comment in

> src/chromium/src/components/policy/tools/syntax_check_policy_template_json.py

> Boolean policies end with "Enabled" by convention? So our policy name:

> `DeviceFlexHwDataForProductImprovementEnabled`.

>

> Although docs/enterprise/add_new_policy.md says we need to add a

> preference and register it in Local State, etc. that doesn't appear to

> be necessary for Device policies.

>

> Tested by copying the chrome_device_policy.proto to a cros_sdk, and

> building libbrillo (with added accessors) against it, then using the new

> accessors to check value.

>

> Change-Id: I49282724a216cf36a09b784f174d0f4c9d589c43
